relation.name: r-antithesis
relation.nucleus: W has positive regard for N.
relation.satellite: In comparison to N, W regards the content of S as less positive or less important.
relation.nucsat: N and S are in contrast (see the Contrast relation); because of the incom- patibility that arises from the contrast, one cannot have positive regard for both of those situations. One subgroup is corrections of the kind "Not A happened, but B." In a tweet, S usually precedes N.
relation.effect: R's positive regard for N is increased.
relation.example: Versuch des Potsdamer Amtsgerichts, ein Grundstück zu verkaufen [Einmal schien es schon geglückt zu sein.]S [Doch der Käufer zahlte nicht.]N (maz- 6193) [Ablehnung gab es nämlich nicht für den Mann,]S [sondern für seinen Posten, der ihn zum Befürworter des Bombodroms machen muss.]N (maz-17300)
relation.comment: Similar relations are Concession and multinuclear Contrast.

relation.name: r-attribution
relation.satellite: The satellite describes the fact that the author expresses the information presented in N.
relation.nucsat: S specifies the original author of information presented in N.
relation.connectives: rarely marked by connectives; usually delimited by dash or colon
relation.example: Friedrich gegen doppelte Staatsangehrigkeit: ["W$auml;re integrationshemmend",]_N [sagt er #berlindirekt.]_S Mehr dazu um 19.10 http://t.co/SIqgDHHO5R

relations.relation:
The nuclei give different kinds of information, hence there is no List enumeration; at the same time they are not in any clearly recognizable semantic or pragmatic relation. Yet there is coherence by contributing to the overall function of the tweet.
R recognizes the distinct functions of the nuclei.
additive connectives such as also, further / zudem, auch
Joint is to be used when a multinuclear relation is in order but none of the "stronger" relations hold.
